thread.title: Italy v Canada Match Ball prize draw: Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Italy v Canada Match Ball prize draw: Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Italy v Canada Match Ball prize draw: Terms and Conditions
text: MasterCard – Rugby World Cup 2015 Italy v Canada Match Ball – Prize Draw Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the United Kingdom (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland) aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and MasterCard Europe sprl (“MasterCard”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. To enter this prize draw, entrants must visit www.telegraph.co.uk/promotions/competitions and complete the required fields on the entry form. Entry is restricted to one per person and once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’ name and county can be obtained by sending a stamped addressed envelope to MasterCard – RWC 2015 Italy v Canada Match Ball Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Friday, September 25, 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within seven days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. One winning entrant will win the Rugby World Cup 2015 match ball from Italy v Canada, which takes place on September 26, 2015. 9. The prize is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 10. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of MasterCard and the Promoter. 11. This promotion is run by the Promoter with the permission RWCL. Accordingly the Promoter is responsible for the operation of and all matters and concerns relating to the promotion, not RWCL or any other persons involved in the staging of Rugby World Cup 2015 (including ER2015) and World Rugby (formerly the International Rugby Board), all of whom shall not be responsible for or liable to entrants in any way whatsoever in connection with this promotion. 12. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 13. The Telegraph is responsible for the administration of the promotion, which includes the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of MasterCard and its agents. 14. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
